ygData.subject: Re: Dinobot.
ygData.msgSnippet: (I apologize for taking so long to post.) Tavatron: *Why do you fight it? You know you can t win.* The deranged laughter of Tavatron s darker counterpart

(I apologize for taking so long to post.)

Tavatron:

*Why do you fight it? You know you can't win.*

The deranged laughter of Tavatron's darker counterpart resounded through her 
aching circuits. There was no escaping it. The rage and anger that 
accompanied each inner breath taunted and teased her as if she were a 
starving dog. There were times when she yearned for the death and 
destruction of her former days as an assassin. The praise and fear that 
followed her as a younger Predacon had often times been more satisfying than 
the slow, uncalculated methods of battle as a Maximal. The hot wind that 
blew at her back merely enforced what she already knew. She was not going to 
win this fight. Tavatron growled softly, her voice was strained and speech a 
luxary she would not be able to afford much longer:

"I-- am fine."

Tavatron pulled herself to her feet. They nearly fell out from beneath her, 
but she was able to catch herself in time and lean on her staff for 
additional support. The sensation of dizziness and need to grasp the ground 
just to know she wasn't falling had passed, but would continue to plague her 
until this slagging program was eliminated:

*What are you thinking?*

Was it possible? Had she finally succeeded where all the scientists and 
programming specialists had failed? *She* was unable to access part of her 
nueral net. The triumphant sensation of knowing there was still one part of 
her mind that was her own rekindled the dying flame of Tavatron's hope:

*You're hiding something. I want to know what! TELL ME!!*

Tavatron pulled herself to her feet, thus ceasing her pathetic leaning on 
her staff. She wasn't some weakling that needed to be nursed back to health. 
She was a Predacon warrior, and would NOT be defeated by some fiteen year 
old piece of programming. The cool confidence that once surrounded *her* had 
begun to melt, and with it what little resolve and patience remained:

*TELL ME!!!*

Tavtron grimaced and stumbled from the force of such a loud, unescapable 
sound. It was one thing to hear a voice from the outside, to be able to run 
from it, even filter through it until only a low hum remained. It was quite 
a different experience when that voice was loud enough to fill the halls of 
the CF, yet contained inside one's head:

*I'm not a voice. You know that. I've got a name.*

Tavatron licked her canines as her gaze drifted away from Dinobot and into 
the distance:

"Shut up..."

Her voice dropped to an inaudible whisper, then again, nothing she ever said 
or did could be hidden from *her*.

"...Tav."
